question: 2. How is the best attribute chosen in ID3?

options.A: A. By selecting the attribute with the highest information gain.
options.B: B. By selecting the attribute with the lowest entropy.
options.C: C. By selecting the attribute with the highest randomness.
options.D: D. By selecting the attribute with the highest average entropy.

options.A: A. A measure of randomness in a variable.
options.B: B. A measure of information gain.
options.C: C. A measure of randomness in a decision tree.
options.D: D. A measure of randomness in a dataset.

options.B: B. Difference between the probabilities of each possible value.

question: 5. What is the goal of the ID3 algorithm?

options.A: A. To maximize entropy in the decision tree.
options.B: B. To minimize entropy in the decision tree.
options.C: C. To maximize information gain in the decision tree.
options.D: D. To minimize information gain in the decision tree.
